topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55144c7e63687214ded00600#post_55144c7e63687214ded00600
If all that other stuff could be done I'm sure anything is possible out that point.


But at the same time EXTREMELY DANGEROUS *AS HELL*.

I like science But I don't want to be there if something goes wrong. I like Teleportation.

But Holy shit If that gets invented I am not going to use it until I know it is 100% safe. Even when it comes to big battle ships I'm sure they are possible for some kind of use.  

But you are right they are a big target. But If you are using a Blackhole as an energy source I'm sure that it will have the power to protect itself if need be. Force Fields and a whole lot of fire power at that.

Also It could be too that they would not be made for war like use. It could be use as like a Space station or a Colony. But at that point I guess they would mostly be Stationary and rarely moved just in case. 

~(Though I do not condone trying to harness the power of a Blackhole as that just screams bad news.)~

I don't live in Arizona.

I live in California now. But it's sunny. ALL THE TIME. Unless it rains. Over there they got themselves Monsoons. Over here we got well Rain.

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5514533263687214de890d00#post_5514533263687214de890d00
Teleportation of humans won't be here for another 100k years because of the energy requirements and that amount of data being able to be processed and put together isn't going to be possible for hundreds of thousands of years.

Black holes for engines?  No dude, just no, that would be too dangerous.

Force fields can't block black holes; nothing can stop a black hole... literally.
